required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Oral LABP-104 in Healthy Adult Male and Female Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Double-Blind, Single-Center Study to Evaluate Safety Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Oral LABP-104 in Healthy Adult Male and Female Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, ascending dose, multi-cohort study. The primary objective of this study is to assess the safety and tolerability of single and 7-day repeat oral doses LABP-104 in healthy adult volunteers.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study will be conducted in 2 parts: a single ascending dose (SAD) part (Part A) and a multiple ascending dose (MAD) part (Part B). A total of 56 participants will be randomized in this study (35 in the SAD part, 21 in the MAD part).
SAD Part: Participants will be randomized to receive a single oral dose of LABP-104 (250 mg, 500 mg, 750 mg, 1000 mg or 1500 mg) or placebo after a 6-hour fast.
MAD Part: Participants will be randomized to receive LABP-104 (250 mg, 750 mg, or 1500 mg) or placebo once daily for 7 days after a 6-hour fast.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence, severity and relationship of AEs;
primary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: 37 days; Part B: 44 days

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in vital signs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: 37 days; Part B: 44 days

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in 12-lead ECG parameters;
primary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: 37 days; Part B: 44 days

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in physical examination findings
primary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: 37 days; Part B: 44 days

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in body weight (Part B only)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: 37 days; Part B: 44 days

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in clinical laboratory parameters (serum chemistry, hematology, coagulation, and urinalysis).
primary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: 37 days; Part B: 44 days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: 37 days; Part B: 44 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of the maximum drug concentration (tmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: 37 days; Part B: 44 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the drug concentration-time curve (AUC0-last)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: 37 days; Part B: 44 days
Part A: 37 days; Part B: 44 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the drug concentration-time curve from time zero to infinity (AUC0-inf) calculated as AUC0-t + Ct/λz, where λz is the apparent terminal elimination rate constant;
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: 37 days; Part B: 44 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the drug concentration-time curve from time zero to 24 hours following dose administration (AUC0-24);
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: 37 days; Part B: 44 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent total clearance of the drug from plasma following oral administration (CL/F), calculated as dose/AUC0-inf;
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: 37 days; Part B: 44 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent terminal elimination half-life (t1/2), calculated as ln(2)/λz;
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: 37 days; Part B: 44 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent volume of distribution Vd/F; calculated as (CL)/ λz.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: 37 days; Part B: 44 days

arm_group.description: Dose escalation in the SAD part of the study (Part A) will be conducted in 5 cohorts (Cohorts 1 to 5). Seven participants will be enrolled in each cohort and randomized to receive either LABP-104 or placebo (ratio 5:2). LABP-104 will be administered to Cohort 1 participants at the starting dose of 250 mg and increased in each new cohort (500 mg, 750 mg, 1000 mg, 1500 mg). It is anticipated that 3 dose levels will be evaluated in Part B in a total of 3 cohorts (Cohorts 6 to 8). Seven participants will be enrolled in each cohort and will be randomized to receive a single oral dose of either LABP-104 or placebo (ratio 5:2), once daily for seven days. LABP-104 dose levels to be evaluated in Part B will be 250 mg, 500 mg, and 1500 mg.

Dose escalation in the SAD part of the study (Part A) will be conducted in 5 cohorts (Cohorts 1 to 5). Seven participants will be enrolled in each cohort and randomized to receive either LABP-104 or placebo (ratio 5:2). LABP-104 will be administered to Cohort 1 participants at the starting dose of 250 mg and increased in each new cohort (500 mg, 750 mg, 1000 mg, 1500 mg). It is anticipated that 3 dose levels will be evaluated in Part B in a total of 3 cohorts (Cohorts 6 to 8). Seven participants will be enrolled in each cohort and will be randomized to receive a single oral dose of either LABP-104 or placebo (ratio 5:2), once daily for seven days. LABP-104 dose levels to be evaluated in Part B will be 250 mg, 500 mg, and 1500 mg.
